author: Joe Kottke
description: Six people were killed Wednesday at a Colorado dairy in an accident that is being investigated as toxic gas exposure, officials said
title: Six dead in accident at Colorado dairy

author: Ben Kamisar
description: California's Democratic-controlled state Legislature passed bills Thursday setting up a high-profile special election this fall, when voters will decide whether to approve the party's plan to gerrymander California's congressional mapDemocratic Gov.
title: California legislators pass redistricting plans to put a Democratic-drawn map before voters

author: Saba Hamedy
description: Six years after claiming that he was the victim of a hate crime, actor Jussie Smollett is continuing to push back against the narrative put forth by Chicago officials that it was all a "hoax."In "The Truth About Jussie Smollett?", a new Netflix documentary that debuts Thursday, the former "Empire" star revisits the legal battle surrounding the alleged attack, which police and city officials said he orchestrated against himself
title: Jussie Smollett revisits attack allegations in new Netflix documentary

author: Daniella Silva
description: The workplace raid in Edison, New Jersey, was one of the largest immigration actions in the region and led to a chaotic scene with panicked family members.
title: Advocates describe chaos and crying family members at a New Jersey immigration raid

author: Ben Kamisar
description: Democratic Rep. Lloyd Doggett, the longest serving member of Texas' congressional delegation, announced Thursday that he will retire instead of running for re-election if new congressional district boundaries aren't rejected in court, after state Republicans carved up his Austin-area home district in new maps
title: Democratic Rep. Lloyd Doggett says he'll retire after Texas redistricting unless courts overturn GOP map

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: A federal judge had ruled that the more than $1 billion in cuts to research grants, like studies into HIV prevention, violated federal law.
title: Supreme Court allows Trump's cuts to health research grants over DEI policies

author: The Politics Desk
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s bare-knuckled approach to fighting the Trump and the GOP is drawing attention on the left and the right.
title: Gavin Newsom takes on Trump at his own game: From the Politics Desk

author: Kimmy Yam
description: The princess of Belgium will be returning to Harvard following a summer of uncertainty for international students because of tensions between the school and the Trump administration.
title: Princess Elisabeth of Belgium is returning to Harvard amid international student battle with Trump administration

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: The federal judge found that Habba has "unlawfully held the role" of the state's top prosecutor for more than a month.
title: Alina Habba's appointment as U.S. attorney for New Jersey was 'unlawful,' judge rules

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: A North Carolina man who says he’s upset about the business next door to his home has put up a sign in his yard asking President Donald Trump to deport people in his neighborhood.
title: Man living next to Hispanic-owned business puts up sign urging Trump to deport his neighbors

author: Doha Madani
description: "Old Town Road" rapper Lil Nas X was arrested and taken to the hospital early Thursday morning after he was walking naked in the street in Los Angeles.
title: Lil Nas X arrested after wandering naked in Los Angeles street and charging at officers, police say

author: Andrew Greif
description: Notre Dame unveiled an updated logo for its storied program — one that emphasizes football while downplaying the "fighting" part of the school's nickname.
title: In Notre Dame's new logo, fists are down and football is in

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Mayor Michelle Wu had said she would “not back down” from the city policy of limiting police from cooperating with ICE on civil immigration enforcement efforts.
title: ICE chief threatens to 'flood' Boston with agents after mayor won't abandon sanctuary policy

author: Patrick Smith
description: LONDON — Fifty-five years after rock ’n’ roll’s most important and influential band split up, The Beatles are to release a new collection of unheard outtakes, as well as a remastered and expanded classic documentary series as part of a reboot of a 1990s "Anthology" project
title: The Beatles to release new outtakes collection and restored documentary series

author: David K. Li
description: Brent Hinds, former guitarist and vocalist with Grammy-winning heavy metal band Mastodon, died in a motorcycle crash in Atlanta late Wednesday night, police said, leaving bandmates in a state of "unfathomable sadness and grief."
title: Brent Hinds, former Mastodon guitarist and vocalist, dies in Atlanta motorcycle crash at 51

author: Monica Alba
description: Trump is expected to greet law enforcement personnel and National Guard troops in Washington, D.C., on Thursday, after he sent federal and military personnel onto the city streets earlier this month in what he said is an effort to fight crime, a White House official said.
title: Trump to visit local law enforcement and National Guard troops in D.C. on Thursday

author: Natasha Korecki
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom's Trump-like social media posts and redistricting push are resonating with Democrats who are eager for a fighter against the GOP.
title: Gavin Newsom strikes a nerve — and seizes the spotlight — as he treads on Trump's turf

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A New Hampshire mother shot and killed two of her children and her husband, who had reportedly been diagnosed with brain cancer, before killing herself, authorities said.
title: Mom killed husband and 2 kids in murder-suicide, New Hampshire authorities say

author: Doha Madani
description: "Stranger Things" star Millie Bobbie Brown announced Thursday that she's adopted a daughter with her husband Jake Bongiovi, the son of singer Jon Bon Jovi.
title: Millie Bobby Brown adopts child with husband Jake Bongiovi

author: Brooke Sopelsa
description: A rainbow crosswalk in Orlando, Florida, that was part of the city’s Pulse Memorial was removed by the state overnight.
title: Pulse Memorial’s rainbow crosswalk removed overnight in Orlando, Florida

author: David K. Li
description: The father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown was arrested and accused of stabbing a man early Wednesday evening in Las Vegas, authorities said
title: Father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown accused of stabbing a man in Las Vegas

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A Tennessee man charged in the brutal murder of an exotic dancer in Arizona has remained in an out-of-state jail for two months on an unrelated probation violation, baffling attorneys who question why he has not been extradited to Maricopa County
title: A man was charged in a brutal Arizona murder. Why hasn't he been extradited from Georgia?

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: A New York appeals court on Thursday dismissed a $500 million civil fraud penalty against President Donald Trump and his companies for routinely over-valuing their properties in financial statements.
title: New York appeals court throws out Trump's $500 million fraud judgment

author: Monica Alba
description: The White House is suspending public tours because of the construction of a 90,000-square-foot ballroom initiated by President Donald Trump, a White House official said.
title: White House suspends tours for ballroom construction

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Two top House Democrats are demanding documents and internal communications related to the federal approval process behind Skydance’s $8 billion acquisition of the media conglomerate Paramount, the parent company of CBS.Reps.
title: House Democrats demand documents related to Skydance-Paramount merger

author: Melanie Zanona
description: Conservative Rep. Chip Roy, who has fought with Donald Trump and Speaker Mike Johnson, said he is running for Texas attorney general in 2026.
title: Rep. Chip Roy, who clashed with Trump and GOP leaders, launches bid for Texas AG

author: Joe Murphy
description: The first hurricane of the 2025 Atlantic season is also one of the largest, fastest-growing hurricanes in recorded history
title: Storm tracker: Follow Hurricane Erin’s path, wind speeds and forecast

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A U.S Navy sailor was convicted Wednesday of espionage after he sold Navy secrets to a Chinese intelligence officer, federal officials said.
title: U.S. Navy sailor convicted of espionage after selling secrets to Chinese intelligence officer

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: The man who allegedly threw a sex toy toward the court during a New York Liberty game striking a 12-year-old girl has been arrested, police said.
title: Man arrested on charges of hitting 12-year-old girl with a sex toy at a WNBA game

author: Shaquille Brewster
description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris on Thursday announced a 15-city book tour that will take her from New York and San Francisco to Toronto and London
title: Kamala Harris announces international book tour for '107 Days'

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: The U.S. lost about 1 million immigrants from January to June, even though the unauthorized population hit a record-setting 14 million two years ago.
title: U.S. immigrant population shrinking for first time since 1960s

author: Aria Bendix
description: Tennis champion Serena Williams said Thursday that she is taking weight loss medication after struggling to see results from diet and exercise following the births of her two daughters, Olympia and Adira.“As an athlete and as someone that has done everything, I just couldn’t get my weight to where I needed to be at a healthy place, and believe me I don’t take shortcuts.
title: Serena Williams reveals she's taking weight loss medication: 'I don't take shortcuts'

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: Hurricane Erin is taking a turn to the northeast and moving away from the coast of North Carolina as rip currents remain a threat in the area, and beachgoers are warned to stay out of the water.
title: Hurricane Erin moving away from the East Coast as Category 2 storm

description: Concessions have been made between the United States and the European Union on a trade deal focusing on pharmaceuticals, lumber and semiconductors. NBC News' Brian Cheung reports on how the deal was reached.
title: White House announces trade deal with the European Union

description: Tennis superstar Serena Williams joins TODAY and clears the air to announce she is taking a GLP-1 medication through Ro, for which she is a paid spokesperson. She opens up about how she hopes this brings the conversation into the open and destigmatizes its use. “I literally tried everything,” she says. “Even I felt like, ‘OK, I don’t want to do this because it is a shortcut or it is, like, a quick way out,’ but it actually isn’t.”
title: Serena Williams Talks Mission to Destigmatize Use of GLP-1s

description: Erik Menendez is expected to make his case before a California parole board Thursday ahead of his older brother Lyle’s hearing on Friday. The critical hearings come after a judge recently ruled to resentence the brothers, making them eligible for release for the first time since they were convicted of the 1989 murders of their parents, José and Kitty, in their Beverly Hills home. NBC’s Liz Kreutz reports for TODAY.
title: Menendez Brothers’ Long-Awaited Parole Hearings Set to Begin

author: Andrew Jones
description: Israel launched strikes on Gaza City overnight as it moved forward with a new offensive in the Palestinian enclave despite international condemnation and mounting domestic protests
title: Israel bombs Gaza City after launching new offensive in defiance of global outrage

description: Russia launched another wave of attacks on Ukraine as the Trump administration looks to move the peace process forward for a potential Putin-Zelenskyy meeting. It comes as Russia's foreign minister is rejecting security guarantees for Ukraine outright. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Russian Foreign Minister Rejects Security Guarantees for Ukraine

description: As lawmakers in the Texas House pass their Trump-backed redistricting plan and send it to the Senate, Democratic states are vowing to retaliate with their own more partisan districts, with California Gov. Gavin Newsom posting "It's on, Texas." NBC’s Ryan Chandler reports for TODAY.
title: Democrats to Retaliate After Texas House Passes Redistricting Plan

description: As Hurricane Erin continues to churn offshore, strong waves, rip current dangers and high winds are leading to beach closures farther up the East Coast from North Carolina’s Outer Banks. NBC’s Erin McLaughlin reports and TODAY’s Dylan Dreyer tracks the latest forecast.
title: Hurricane Erin Pounds East Coast With Massive Waves, Flooding

author: Steve Kopack
description: The United States has agreed to limit tariffs on pharmaceuticals, lumber and semiconductors imported from the European Union to 15%, according to an agreement released Thursday
title: Trump backs down on threats of higher tariffs for E.U. pharma and chips

author: Patrick Smith
description: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' request for an acquittal or a new trial should be quickly rejected, prosecutors said in a new court filing almost three weeks after the music mogul was convicted of two charges related to prostitution
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' request for acquittal or new trial should be rejected, prosecutors say

author: Jennifer Jett
description: North Korea has a covert military base near the Chinese border that poses a “potential nuclear threat” to the United States mainland, according to new research
title: North Korea may have a secret base near China with missiles that could reach the U.S.

author: Bridget Bowman
description: PASSAIC, N.J. — With an empanada in one hand, Republican Jack Ciattarelli spent part of last Saturday afternoon at El Primito restaurant here, making his case to be New Jersey's next governor instead of Democratic Rep.
title: After Trump's gains, the next big test of the Latino vote is looming this year

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Erik and Lyle Menendez are taking another step on what could be their path to freedom
title: California parole officials to decide if Menendez brothers should be released

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: More than 430 people have been killed after intense deluges swallowed entire villages in mountainous India and Pakistan as climate change intensifies what experts say are called “rain bombs” or cloudbursts
title: Cloudbursts have killed over 400 people in South Asia. What are they?

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: If you’re in good health and plan to get a Covid shot this fall, you might end up with an unwelcome surprise: a bill
title: For some, fall Covid shots may come with copays — or no coverage at all

author: Rob Wile
description: Fresh data released this week underscored just how stuck the U.S. housing market is
title: Housing freeze: High costs leave some buyers and current owners in the lurch

author: Daryna Mayer
description: Ukraine has said it expects rapid progress on the security guarantees its allies could provide in a peace deal with Russia, but that one of the possible summit sites being pursued by the United States would be "challenging."
title: Zelenskyy urges quick progress on security guarantees, says possible summit site 'challenging'

author: Chloe Yang
description: A fire aboard a U.S. warship was declared extinguished early Thursday, 12 hours after it started off the coast of Okinawa, Japan, with two sailors being treated for minor injuries
title: 2 sailors injured in fire on U.S. warship in Japan, Navy says

author: Nnamdi Egwuonwu
description: A longtime ally, adviser and fundraiser for New York Mayor Eric Adams was suspended from his re-election effort after she was accused of attempting to hand a local journalist a cash-stuffed potato chip bag
title: Eric Adams adviser suspended from campaign after being accused of giving local reporter cash

author: Allan Smith
description: In recent weeks, the Trump administration has targeted Democratic officials over allegations of mortgage fraud, a new front in an effort to undermine critics.
title: Trump administration's newest allegation against political foes: Mortgage fraud

author: Phil Helsel
description: Yarely Ashley Hermosillo, an online content creator, was killed in Arizona after a gunman fired in a random direction during an argument between the drivers of two other vehicles, police said.
title: Influencer killed when a gunman fires randomly during argument on Arizona road

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The husband of a woman found dead in California's Angeles National Forest last week is suspected in her death, and is believed to be in Peru, officials said.
title: Husband of woman found dead in Angeles National Forest may have fled to Peru, officials say

author: Monica Alba
description: The former president lent his support to Gavin Newsom's retaliatory redistricting plan shortly before Texas Republicans passed a bill redrawing congressional lines.
title: 'A responsible approach': Obama backs California's response to Texas' new congressional lines
